name: jack
content:
jack noun
(EQUIPMENT)
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ C ] a piece of equipment that can be opened slowly under a heavy object such as a car in order to raise it off the ground: You need a car jack in order to change a tyre.
DonNichols/iStock/Getty Images Plus/GettyImages

jack noun
(CARD)
[ C ] (also knave) a playing card with a picture of a man on it. It has a lower value than the cards showing a king or queen: the jack of clubs
eldadcarin/iStock/Getty Images Plus/GettyImages

jack noun
(BALL)
[ C ] a small ball towards which other balls are rolled or thrown in the games of bowls or boules
Tobiesmom/E+/GettyImages

jack noun
(STAR-SHAPED OBJECT)
[ C usually plural ] a small star-shaped object used in the game of jacks, in which you throw a ball into the air and try to pick up as many as possible of these objects with the same hand before catching the ball again
Joe_Potato/iStock/Getty Images Plus/GettyImages

jack noun
(GAME)
jacks
[ U ] a children's game in which you throw a ball into the air and try to pick up as many small star-shaped objects as possible with the same hand before catching the ball again: The girls were playing jacks on the front steps.
See more
jack noun
(ELECTRICAL)
[ C ] a connection between two pieces of electrical equipment

jack noun
(NOTHING)
[ U ] slang (also offensive slang jack shit, uk/ˌdʒæk ˈʃɪt/ us/ˌdʒæk ˈʃɪt/) nothing: I know jack about fashion, but I know what I like to wear. There's jack shit to do here.
jack noun [C]
(DEVICE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
a device used to raise and hold something heavy off the ground, esp. one for raising a vehicle so that a tire can be changed
jack noun [C]
(CARD)
a playing card that has a picture of a man on it and has a lower value than the cards showing a king or queen: the jack of diamonds
jack noun [C]
(ELECTRICITY)
a hole into which a wire connected to a piece of electrical equipment can be plugged so that the equipment can operate: a microphone jack
